issues.description: The problem text explicitly instructs students to implement the helper method singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) as public for easier testing (problem_statement.md lines 112-116). However, the template defines singFarmSongVerse as a private method with its parameter commented out (template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java line 18) and the solution also implements it as private (solution_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Farm.java lines 33-54). This is a signature & visibility mismatch: the template/solution provide a private, parameterless method stub while the task text requires a public method that accepts an Animal parameter. Students following the textual instruction will be confused by the provided private/no-parameter stub and automated tests that expect a public method with the Animal parameter may fail.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper method's signature consistent with the problem text and tests: change the method in the template (and solution if intended) to public and accept an Animal parameter, e.g. public void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal). Update the method body accordingly. Alternatively, if the intention was to keep it private, update the problem text to not require a public helper method and adjust the tests/instructions.

issues.description: There is an internal contradiction inside the problem statement: the UML fragment for Farm declares singFarmSongVerse(animal: Animal):void as private (UML shows '-' visibility at problem_statement.md lines 16-21), while the textual instructions later state the helper singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) should be public for easier testing (lines 112-116). This conflicting guidance (UML vs. textual instruction) can confuse students about the intended visibility.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the UML and the textual instruction: if tests require the helper to be public, update the UML to show the method as public (use '+' in the UML). If the method should be private, update the textual instruction to not require a public helper and clarify how the song will be tested. Prefer making the helper public if external tests call it.
